comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: Is that a date, 8-23-12, scratched into the back, so it appears as inverted mirror writing.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I think it's 2-13-12. In which case, it is probably as a result of the storm reported in the NYT: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B0CE7DD1F31E233A...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to NYT August 15, 1908 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D03E7D7123EE233A... Hepner was a wigmaker with a store at 1460 Broadway, which is consistent with numbers on storefront at right.

comment.author: 46317563@N04
comment._content: For a view of the sign that might have been the one that fell, see digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/id?717474F The Hotel Aberdeen (later Hotel Calvert) Broadway and 41st was one of Park & Tilford's (Fancy Grocers) many locations digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/id?800390

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thanks retired at last and swanq for deciphering the date and finding the background information  to the photo in the New York Times. We will add some of it to the description for this photo and the related photo  identified by Richard Arthur Norton when we update.
